page.title: 04The Forester's Talk:N.Silton
page.content: On Tuesday,18 June 1985 Mr Davison who is Head Forester over N.Yorkshire visited our school and gave us the following information on the large forest in our area. Silton Forest was bought in 1954 from Mr Fleming who owned the Silton Estate.Most of the forest was rough grazing for sheep farming consisting of heather,bracken,juncas grass,bilberry and thorn bushes.There were 8 hectares of standing crop consisting of European Larch and Scots Pine which were not in first class condition and had been planted in 1939.Soils were mostly surface water gleys,peaty clays and brown earth.Iron pan soil is what the forest is mostly made up of.The surface is ploughed and drained and the iron pan broken up before planting.
